channel.title: briefUpdatesBreakingOffshootNL
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from briefUpdatesBreakingOffshootNL, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Bedrock, an A.I. Start-Up for Construction, Raises $270 Million
item.description: The two-year-old company, founded by veterans of the autonomous vehicle business Waymo, is seeking to automate excavators and other building equipment...

item.title: Bezos orders deep job cuts at 'Washington Post'
item.description: The Washington Post embarked on severe cuts despite appeals by the newsroom to owner Jeff Bezos. The paper is to narrow its focus largely to politics ...

item.title: Congress faces tight deadline to fund DHS. And, Ryan Routh faces sentencing

item.title: Photos: Scenes from the 150th Westminster Dog Show
item.description: Hundreds of dogs competed for the top prize at the Westminster Kennel Club Dog Show this week. Penny the Doberman pinscher was named best in show.

item.title: Savannah Guthrie’s Missing Mother Has Nation Fixated on an Arizona Subdivision

item.title: In Afghanistan, a Trail of Hunger and Death Behind U.S. Aid Cuts
item.description: Afghanistan has plunged deeper into a crisis marked by levels of child hunger unseen in 25 years and the closure of almost 450 health centers.

item.title: Greetings from Kyiv, where candles are the last option during wartime blackouts
item.description: Far-Flung Postcards is a weekly series in which NPR's international team shares moments from their lives and work around the world.

item.title: How a Black fossil digger became a superstar in the very white world of paleontology

item.title: Why A.I. Fears Are Battering Stocks, Again
item.description: New tools by artificial intelligence companies like Anthropic have reignited worries that businesses will pare down their subscriptions to software se...

item.description: Afghanistan has plunged deeper into a crisis marked by levels of child hunger unseen in 25 years and the closure of almost 450 health centers.

item.title: South Korea Questions Cram School Culture and Childhood Stress
item.description: Academic pressure has become so intense that even preschoolers are taking private extracurricular classes, raising worries about children’s rights.

item.title: Yair Golan’s Battle for a Two-State Solution and the Future of Israel
item.description: To many Israelis, he’s a war hero. To others, he’s a traitor guilty of “blood libel.” Can Yair Golan change politics in Israel?
